title: The Exploration Company Tests Pre-Burner for High-Thrust Rocket Engine
summary:
The Exploration Company has completed a six-week test campaign of a pre-burner, marking a key step in the development of its high-thrust Typhoon rocket engine. The test campaign was, however, not without its challenges. With co-financing from the French space agency CNES, The Exploration Company kicked off the development of its Typhoon rocket engine in […]
The post The Exploration Company Tests Pre-Burner for High-Thrust Rocket Engine appeared first on European Spaceflight.

summary:

title: Hubble Captures a Cosmic Cloudscape
summary: The universe is a dusty place, as this NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image featuring swirling clouds of gas and dust near the Tarantula Nebula reveals. Located in the Large Magellanic Cloud about 160,000 light-years away in the constellations Dorado and Mensa, the Tarantula Nebula is the most productive star-forming region in the nearby universe, home […]

title: Fly! Project media briefing
summary: Watch the latest updates on ESA’s Fly! Feasibility Study with Daniel Neuenschwander, ESA Director of Human and Robotic Exploration, John McFall, Member of the ESA Astronaut Reserve & Fly! Subject Matter Expert, Jerome Reineix, Fly! Study Manager, and Alessandro Alcibiade, Fly! Flight Surgeon.

title: Earth from Space: Heart of Mount St Helens
Pierogi in space
summary: In a first for space cuisine, ESA project astronaut Sławosz Uznański-Wiśniewski will bring pierogi, the traditional Polish dumplings, to the International Space Station during the upcoming Axiom Mission 4.

title: Sols 4452-4453: Keeping Warm and Keeping Busy
summary: Earth planning date: Wednesday, Feb. 12, 2025 I woke up this morning to my weather app telling me it felt like minus 15° C (5°F) outside. On days like this, it can take me a little longer to get myself up and out into the world. Curiosity has a similar problem — as we head […]
